title: Ancient DNA reveals mysterious Indigenous lineage that lived in Argentina for nearly 8,500 years — but rarely interacted with others
summary: A previously unknown Indigenous population lived in central Argentina for nearly 8,500 years, a new genetic study finds.

title: The Physics of the Northern Lights
summary: The aurora borealis is usually seen near the Arctic, but solar winds and magnetic turbulence are sparking some of the best light shows in centuries throughout the US.

title: غسل مليارين بعقود ادخار
summary: شكوك تحوم حول شخص يكتتب بمبالغ مالية في منتوجات تأمين ويعيد فسخ العقد قبل انتهاء المدة أثار اكتتاب أحد الأشخاص الذاتيين في عقود تأمينات الادخار وإعادة شرائها، قبل انتهاء المدة المحددة، شكوكا لدى مسؤولين بإحدى شركات التأمين، الذين أشعروا الهيأة الوطنية للمعلومات المالية بوجود شبهات غسل أموالأكمل الق…
body: شكوك تحوم حول شخص يكتتب بمبالغ مالية في منتوجات تأمين ويعيد فسخ العقد قبل انتهاء المدة أثار اكتتاب أحد الأشخاص الذاتيين في عقود تأمينات الادخار وإعادة شرائها، قبل انتهاء المدة المحددة، شكوكا لدى مسؤولين بإحدى شركات التأمين، الذين أشعروا الهيأة الوطنية للمعلومات المالية بوجود شبهات غسل أموال أكمل القراءة » المقالة غسل مليارين بعقود ادخار fمنشورة على جريدة الصباح .

title: James Webb telescope may have found the universe's first generation of stars
summary: The James Webb Space Telescope may have discovered Population III stars, the universe's first generation of stars. They may tell us more about how galaxies form.

title: “سيماغلوتيد”… علاج مبتكر لمرضى السكري
summary: يساهم في تقليص مخاطر المضاعفات شرط إدارة المرض بطرق علمية وفعالة أطلقت شركة نوفو نورديسك، أخيرا، “سيماغلوتيد”، وهو علاج مبتكر مخصص لداء السكري من النوع الثاني، متوفر بتركيزات مختلفة تشمل 0.25 مليغرام، و 0.5 ، و1، وهي المناسبة التي جمعت أزيد من 400 من الأطر الصحية والخبراءأكمل القراءة » المقالة “سيم…
body: يساهم في تقليص مخاطر المضاعفات شرط إدارة المرض بطرق علمية وفعالة أطلقت شركة نوفو نورديسك، أخيرا، “سيماغلوتيد”، وهو علاج مبتكر مخصص لداء السكري من النوع الثاني، متوفر بتركيزات مختلفة تشمل 0.25 مليغرام، و 0.5 ، و1، وهي المناسبة التي جمعت أزيد من 400 من الأطر الصحية والخبراء أكمل القراءة » المقالة “سيماغلوتيد”… علاج مبتكر لمرضى السكري fمنشورة على جريدة الصباح .

title: Money and power underlie mysterious Andean ‘band of holes’
summary:
Nature, Published online: 12 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03660-x

The purpose of the pre-Hispanic Monte Sierpe site in Peru has long baffled researchers.
body: Nature, Published online: 12 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03660-x The purpose of the pre-Hispanic Monte Sierpe site in Peru has long baffled researchers.

title: Influential list of highly cited researchers now shuts out more scientists: here’s why
summary:
Nature, Published online: 12 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03691-4

Rule change weeds out many who co-author papers with others linked to suspicious practices.
body: Nature, Published online: 12 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03691-4 Rule change weeds out many who co-author papers with others linked to suspicious practices.

title: How geopolitics is reshaping research: Data hint at shifting collaborations
summary:
Nature, Published online: 12 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03025-4

Individual researchers and academic bodies are choosing not to work with other nations’ scientists amid geopolitical tensions. Is this affecting research…
body: Nature, Published online: 12 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03025-4 Individual researchers and academic bodies are choosing not to work with other nations’ scientists amid geopolitical tensions. Is this affecting research output?

title: Is ageing a disease? The debate that could reshape medicine
summary:
Nature, Published online: 12 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03525-3

Classifying ageing as a disease might bring funding and other benefits, say some researchers, but others say this is fraught with ethical and regulatory …
body: Nature, Published online: 12 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03525-3 Classifying ageing as a disease might bring funding and other benefits, say some researchers, but others say this is fraught with ethical and regulatory implications.

title: Chinese researchers reveal unexplored section of mysterious Arctic Ocean ridge
summary:
Nature, Published online: 12 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03679-0

Oceanographers hope to find otherworldly ecosystems at hydrothermal vents on the seafloor.
body: Nature, Published online: 12 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03679-0 Oceanographers hope to find otherworldly ecosystems at hydrothermal vents on the seafloor.

title: Three rising stars in ageing research
summary:
Nature, Published online: 12 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03526-2

From Alzheimer’s to obesity, these researchers are tackling the most common age-related conditions.
body: Nature, Published online: 12 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03526-2 From Alzheimer’s to obesity, these researchers are tackling the most common age-related conditions.

title: Strongest solar flare of 2025 erupts — and it could bring auroras to half the US on Wednesday
summary: The most powerful solar flare of 2025 has launched a ball of energy toward Earth that could trigger widespread auroras across the northern half of the United States.

title: Astronomers detect first 'radio signal' from interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS — but it wasn't aliens
summary: Astronomers at South Africa's MeerKAT radio telescope have detected the first radio waves coming from the interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS. But while this sounds suspiciously like alien activity, it is actually further proof of its completely natural origins.

title: No, comet 3I/ATLAS hasn't exploded — and no, that doesn't mean it's an alien spaceship
summary: Comet 3I/ATLAS appears to be normal and intact, despite some reports that the interstellar visitor exploded after its brush with the sun.

title: Prehistoric Jomon people in Japan had 'little to no' DNA from the mysterious Denisovans, study finds
summary: The prehistoric Jomon people of Japan had "unexpectedly low" levels of DNA from the Denisovans, our mysterious human relatives.

title: This week's Leonid meteor shower could be one of the best in years. Here's why.
summary: The Leonids peak overnight Nov. 16-17, offering up to 15 meteors per hour under dark, moonless skies.

title: Extreme 'paradise' volcano in Costa Rica is like a piece of ancient Mars on our doorstep — Earth from space
summary: A 2025 satellite photo captures the stark contrast between the barren Poás volcano and the surrounding Costa Rican jungle. The volcano's super-acidic lake provides the perfect analog for studying how hardy microbes may have emerged on Mars billions of years ago.

title: For the first time, physicists peer inside the nucleus of a molecule using electrons as a probe
summary: A novel experiment has revealed a phenomenon called the Bohr–Weisskopf effect in a pear-shaped nucleus in a molecule for the first time.

title: Science history: Russian mathematician quietly publishes paper — and solves one of the most famous unsolved conjectures in mathematics — Nov. 11, 2002
summary: Mathematician Grigori Perelman solved the Poincaré conjecture, and then rejected the $1 million prize that came with it.

title: China’s new scientist visa is a ‘serious bid’ for the world’s top talent
summary:
Nature, Published online: 11 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03657-6

The country is easing migration for young researchers to boost its competitiveness in artificial intelligence, robotics and new materials.
body: Nature, Published online: 11 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03657-6 The country is easing migration for young researchers to boost its competitiveness in artificial intelligence, robotics and new materials.

title: How genetically encoded sensors have lit up neuroscience
summary:
Nature, Published online: 11 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03639-8

Tools that track specific molecules in neurons have enabled researchers to probe previously unexplored aspects of neurobiology — although important cavea…
body: Nature, Published online: 11 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03639-8 Tools that track specific molecules in neurons have enabled researchers to probe previously unexplored aspects of neurobiology — although important caveats remain.

title: 2,300-year-old tool used for skull surgery unearthed at Celtic settlement in Poland
summary: The uniquely shaped iron surgery implement dates to the fourth to third centuries B.C.

title: New 'nearly interstellar' comet — wrongly linked to 3I/ATLAS — will reach its closest point to Earth on Tuesday (Nov. 11)
summary: Newly discovered comet C/2025 V1 (Borisov), which has some minor similarities to 3I/ATLAS, will make its closest approach to Earth on Tuesday (Nov. 11). However, despite recent rumors, the two objects are not related to one another.

title: The First Radio Signal From Comet 3I/Atlas Ends the Debate About Its Nature
summary: An observatory detected the first radio signal from the interstellar object 3I/Atlas. Here’s what it means.

title: Is it aliens? Here's why that's the least important question about 3I/ATLAS.
summary: Conspiracy theories have raged about 3I/ATLAS being an unnatural object. But the alien question, while fun, generates misinformation and distracts from the science.

title: Anomalies in Giza pyramid may indicate an unknown entrance
summary: Two voids found on the eastern face of Menkaure's pyramid may indicate the presence of a second entrance.

title: 'The universe will just get colder and deader from now on': Euclid telescope confirms star formation has already peaked in the cosmos
summary: Astronomers using data from ESA's Euclid and Herschel space telescopes have confirmed that star formation has already peaked in the cosmos, and that the universe is bound to get steadily 'colder and deader' from here on.

title: Scientists may finally have an explanation for the centuries-old 5,200 mystery holes in the Peruvian Andes
summary: Drone footage and on-the-ground excavations high in the Andes are revealing what the Chincha Kingdom and Inca Empire may have used these holes for centuries ago.

title: Ram-shaped teapot from ancient Canaanite cult discovered near ancient city of Armageddon
summary: Archaeologists have discovered a ram-shaped tea pot and one of the oldest old wine presses in the world that date to the time of the Canaanites during the Bronze Age.

title: Unprecedented radio view of the Milky Way took over 40,000 hours to construct — Space photo of the week
summary: Created using data from two extensive surveys, this spectacular radio image of the galactic plane of the Milky Way provides valuable insights into the birth and death of stars.

title: 'The images could be much older': Analysis of rocks shows Neanderthals made art at least 64,000 years ago
summary: Art has sometimes thought to be exclusive to modern humans.

title: 'Unlike any we've ever seen': Record-breaking black hole eruption is brighter than 10 trillion suns
summary: Astronomers spotted a flaring black hole that may be consuming a star at least 30 times more massive than the sun. At its peak, the flare was brighter than 10 trillion stars.

title: 13th-century Christian songbook made of furry sealskin may be Norway's oldest surviving book
summary: Experts at the National Library of Norway believe the liturgical songbook was made by a local artisan around A.D. 1200.

title: Triple Divide Peak: Montana's unique liquid 'crossroads' where water can flow into three oceans
summary: Triple Divide Peak in Montana is the only place on Earth where water can flow into one of three different oceans, according to some definitions.

title: International PhD student numbers in US hold steady — for now
summary:
Nature, Published online: 07 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03653-w

Trend flies in face of Trump-administration policies, but could yet see a rapid decrease, especially in science fields.
body: Nature, Published online: 07 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03653-w Trend flies in face of Trump-administration policies, but could yet see a rapid decrease, especially in science fields.

title: "سبيس إكس" تقترح على ناسا خطة لإرسال البشر إلى القمر
summary: أعلنت شركة سبيس إكس، المملوكة للملياردير الأميركي إيلون ماسك، الخميس، أنها اقترحت على إدارة الطيران والفضاء الأميركية (ناسا) خطة مبسطة لإرسال البشر إلى القمر.
